title: Erdős Problem #884: Divisor Gap Sums
description: Is Σ_{i<j} 1/(d_j - d_i) bounded by C(1 + Σ_i 1/(d_{i+1} - d_i)) for the divisors d_1 < ... < d_t of n? All-pairs sum vs consecutive-pairs sum. OPEN.

overview.historicalContext: Erdős Problem #884 from [Er98] asks about the relationship between two sums over divisor gaps. Given the divisors d_1 < d_2 < ... < d_t of n, the all-pairs sum (over all i < j) is compared with the consecutive-pairs sum. Related to Problem #144 on divisor arithmetic.
overview.problemStatement: Let d_1 < d_2 < ... < d_t be the divisors of n. Is there an absolute constant C such that Σ_{i<j} 1/(d_j - d_i) ≤ C(1 + Σ_i 1/(d_{i+1} - d_i))? OPEN.
overview.proofStrategy: The formalization defines divisorList (sorted divisors), consecutiveGap, generalGap, allPairsSum, and consecutivePairsSum. The conjecture ErdosConjecture884 is axiomatized. Structural lemmas (gap bounds, multiplicativity of τ) and examples (prime case equality, n=6) are axiomatized. Proved: consecutivePairsSum_num_terms (simp), erdos_884_statement (rfl).
keyInsights: All-pairs sum has O(τ²) terms; consecutive-pairs sum has O(τ) terms
For primes, both sums equal 1/(p-1) — conjecture holds trivially
d_j - d_i is a sum of consecutive gaps (telescoping), so general gaps are larger
Multiplicative structure: τ(mn) = τ(m)τ(n) for coprime m,n affects gap patterns
Related to Problem #144 on divisor arithmetic and Egyptian fractions

sections.title: Part I: Divisor Lists
sections.summary: Defines divisorList (sorted), numDivisors (τ), divisor accessor. Axioms: divisorList_sorted, mem_divisorList_iff.

sections.title: Part II: Divisor Gaps
sections.summary: Defines consecutiveGap and generalGap. Axioms: consecutiveGap_pos, generalGap_pos.

sections.title: Part III: The Two Sums
sections.summary: Defines allPairsSum (sum over all pairs) and consecutivePairsSum (sum over consecutive pairs).

sections.title: Part IV: The Main Conjecture
sections.summary: Defines ErdosConjecture884: exists C > 0 with allPairsSum ≤ C(1 + consecutivePairsSum). Axiom erdos_884.

sections.title: Part VI: Examples
sections.summary: Axioms: divisors_6, divisors_prime, prime_case_equality (primes have equal sums).

sections.title: Part VII: Structural Lemmas
sections.summary: Axioms: gap_lower_bound (general gap ≥ consecutive gap), numDivisors_mul_coprime.

sections.title: Part VIII: Connections
sections.summary: Defines divisorHarmonicSum (σ_{-1}(n)). Placeholder connection to Problem #144.

sections.title: Part IX: Summary
sections.summary: Proved: erdos_884_statement (rfl), erdos_884_status (trivial). Problem remains OPEN.

conclusion.summary: Erdős Problem #884 remains OPEN. The question is whether the all-pairs divisor gap sum is bounded by an absolute constant times (1 + the consecutive-pairs sum). For primes the sums are equal; for composites the relationship is subtle.
conclusion.implications: Resolution would clarify the arithmetic structure of divisor sequences and the relationship between local (consecutive) and global (all pairs) gap information.
openQuestions: Does the inequality hold with some absolute constant C?
What is the optimal constant C if it exists?
How does the ratio behave for highly composite numbers?
What is the connection to Egyptian fractions (Problem #144)?
